Problem:
{
    "python_code": [
      "def process_purchase(user, item):",
      "    user.decrease_balance(item.price)",
      "    item.reduce_stock(1)",
      "    track_event('purchase', user, item)",
      "    return user, item",
      "",
      "class User:",
      "    def __init__(self, name, balance):",
      "        self.name = name",
      "        self.balance = balance",
      "",
      "    def decrease_balance(self, amount):",
      "        if amount <= self.balance:",
      "            self.balance -= amount",
      "            return True",
      "        return False",
      "",
      "class Item:",
      "    def __init__(self, name, stock, price):",
      "        self.name = name",
      "        self.stock = stock",
      "        self.price = price",
      "",
      "    def reduce_stock(self, quantity):",
      "        if self.stock >= quantity:",
      "            self.stock -= quantity",
      "            return True",
      "        return False",
      "",
      "def track_event(event_type, user, item):",
      "    print(f'Event: {event_type}, User: {user.name}, Item: {item.name}')"
    ]
  },

If a user's balance decreased, does this imply a purchase was made?
Explanation: Decrease in balance can occur due to reasons other than a purchase, as the decrease_balance method may be called by other functions or under different circumstances not depicted in the provided segment.
